Module com.example.froggeroop
Package com.example.froggeroop.models

Class GameModel

java.lang.Object
com.example.froggeroop.models.GameModel
public class GameModel extends Object
GameModel is a model-type module that contains the attributes and methods related to the Game view.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    GameModel()
    Model constructor that will initialize some objects of the game.

      Returns:

      Move the player's entity inside the game depending on a given direction
      Parameters:
      direction - enum-type direction

    • getRoad

      public Road getRoad()
      Get back the road (collection of Lanes with bound methods) of the game.
      Returns:
      Road -type object

    • addToTimer

      public void addToTimer​(Timer timer)
      Add the model as observant of a timer
      Parameters:
      timer - an observable Timer

      Get back the score of the game
      Returns:

      public void setScore​(int score)
      Set the score of the game
      Parameters:
      score - an integer characterizing the score

    • initializeChain

      public Expert initializeChain()
      Initialize the chain of responsibility that manages the different possible situations taking place in the game
      Returns:
      The first expert of that chain

    • incCoins

      public void incCoins()
      Increments the number of coins collected by the player.

    • getCoinCollected

      public int getCoinCollected()
      Get back the number of coins the player has collected.
      Returns:
      integer characterizing the number of coins collected.

    • getCor

      public Expert getCor()
      Get back the first expert of the chain of responsibility.
      Returns:
      an Expert-type object.

    • manageScore

      public void manageScore​(int laps)
      Manage the score of the game, requires to know the number of laps from the beginning of the game. Depending on the mode, the score is managed differently
      Parameters:
      laps - number of laps from the main Timer.

    • scroll

      public void scroll​(Timer timerForLanes)
      Used in infinite-mode, this method will move the visible lanes one lane further.
      Parameters:
      timerForLanes - Timer-type that send signals to the visible lane.
